summary:
Experienced policy analyst, ethnographer, and researcher with a demonstrated history of working in the social justice and development domain. 

Skilled in research, policy making, advocacy, project management, team leading, qualitative data analysis, teaching, training, fundraising, community organising, and advising Non-Governmental Organizations (NGOs). Worked in collaboration with international agencies, including the United Nations.

treasury_media.title: Brahmanical patriarchy and the politics of anti-trafficking and prostitution governance: from colonial to contemporary India
Global Development Review Podcast
treasury_media.description: This international podcast series engages with global development issues and understands how the development of policies, practices and politics contributes or challenges the social, epistemic, economic and political justice.

treasury_media.title: 20 Years of Impact of the Palermo Protocol: Contestation and Reflections
treasury_media.description: This is part of a forthcoming Global Policy book on modern slavery. Contributions from leading experts highlighting practical and theoretical issues surrounding the persistence of slavery, human trafficking and forced labour are being serialised...

treasury_media.title: Human Trafficking in India: How the Colonial Legacy of the Anti-Human Trafficking Regime Undermines Migrant and Worker Agency
treasury_media.description: Current demand to tackle human trafficking and protect migrant’s rights signifies a shift from law enforcement focused intervention to human rights and protection of worker’s rights.

treasury_media.title: Anti-Trafficking Bill: What Meenakshi Lekhi's Suggestions Got Wrong
treasury_media.description: Those seen as ‘victims’ of trafficking need their own voice in the process of their welfare, rather than a paternalistic policy system that negates their agency.

treasury_media.title: What are the everyday realities of 'trafficked persons'?

projects.title: Vital Cities and Citizens
projects.description:
Over half of the world’s population lives in cities. This will have risen to 66 percent by 2050. Cities in Asia and the sub-Sahara in particular are faced with mass migration from rural areas. As a result, the poor population in these cities is growing at a rapid rate. Globalisation, technological change, international migration and growing inequality are increasing the complexity of the social structure and cultural makeup of cities worldwide.

With the Erasmus Initiative ‘Vital Cities and Citizens’, Erasmus University Rotterdam wants to help improve the quality of life in cities. In vital cities, the population can achieve their life goals through education, useful work and participation in public life. The vital city is a platform for creativity and diversity, a safe meeting place for different social groups.

By exploring how social changes affect city life, researchers can help cities to flourish. In this Erasmus Initiative, researchers from different disciplines work closely together to identify the conditions for equal opportunities in life, safe living environments and harmonious co-existence for an increasingly diverse population.

projects.title: National Research Study on Human Trafficking in India
Global Education Mission
projects.description: This project aims to educate the conflict effected children of a tribal region in Border district of Jammu and Kashmir. It is an initiative of Jammu and Kashmir Confederation of Civil Liberties, which provide education to hundreds of marginalized children of the region. I am associated as a senior advisor to the overall policies of the project.

company.name: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam

profile_positions.company: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam
profile_positions.description: My current research focuses on the policies and practices related to Human Trafficking, labour unfreedom, and migration governance in South Asian Countries. It aims to learn from the standpoint and experience of marginalised migrants who get intervened by anti-trafficking governing actors.
profile_positions.title: Scientific Researcher (Vital Cities and Citizens Initiative)

profile_positions.description: I contributed by managing and leading an all India national team of a "National Policy Research initiative on Human Trafficking in India". It was a multi-partner policy-oriented initiative of UN Women, UNODC, TISS, Ministry of Women and Child Development, National Commission for Women, Tata Trust and National Human Rights Commission of India. I was part of the founding team and managed this project for four years, which was operational in all the states and Union Territories of India.
profile_positions.title: Lead Policy Researcher
Member, Technical Advisory Group for Northern India Prevalence Study on Human Trafficking

company.name: Ministry of Women and Child Development, Govt. of India

profile_positions.company: Ministry of Women and Child Development, Govt. of India
profile_positions.description: The Ministry of Women and Child Development, (MWCD), Govt of India prepared a draft of the proposed new law on human trafficking announced on 30th May 2016. Based on the comments from various quarters, the draft was revised. The MWCD arranged a regional consultation on this revised draft and I was entrusted with the task of coordination for consultation with civil society, academics & NGOs in Mumbai on behalf of MWCD.
profile_positions.title: Coordinator for Regional Consultation on India Trafficking in Persons Bill, 2016

profile_positions.description: Worked on a Research project to analyse 'Reflective Practices' in the organisation structure along with team member from Uganda, Canada, Sweden, UK, Germany and US.The task also included to learn, analyse and interpret social work practices and professionalization in Sweden. It also included to interpret the Swedish perspective on social work and youth empowerment.The organisation is working on Youth empowerment and Development in Sweden.
profile_positions.title: Youth Empowerment, Keks International, Sweden

company.name: Society for Awareness, Harmony and Equal Rights, Mumbai

profile_positions.company: Society for Awareness, Harmony and Equal Rights, Mumbai
profile_positions.description:
I was working on Documentation, Project Proposal writing, advocacy, Event management, Media Communication, Public Relations, Community Development. I took an Initiative as a student social worker, mobilized women of the slum community and minority and succeeded to establish a self help group in the slum area of Jogeshwari, Mumbai. I organised a peace rally and peace week, an event to bring the ethos of communal harmony among the people of the communal tense Jogeshwari area in Mumbai.I also actively participated in bringing fund from funders for modernization of education of a Madarsa in the locality and succeeded in it. I also worked for the post matric scholarship of Muslim students in the community.

I also worked on research work of the organisation along with a team member from Sierra leone and Netherland and renowned artists from Bollywood.
profile_positions.title: Youth Empowerment, Livelihood, Peace and Education. SAHER)
